articles.title: Two Plagues in Lombardy
articles.description: Literature amid a pandemic.

articles.author: John Hirschauer, John Hirschauer
articles.title: Descensus Christi ad Inferos
articles.description: Holy Saturday -- sometimes called "Black Saturday" -- is the day after Good Friday, and has traditionally been associated with Christ's "Harrowing of Hell."

articles.author: Madeleine Kearns, Madeleine Kearns
articles.title: Zadie Smith on Corpses
articles.description: Zadie Smith's 2013 piece feels eerily close to the bone (if you’ll pardon the pun) now that everyone has mortality on the brain.

articles.author: Jack Fowler, Jack Fowler
articles.title: The Final Nudge: A-Maize-ing Contribution
articles.description: If I could nudge those of you who have been intending to join the ranks of our webathon donors, I’m pretty sure we’d hit our goal of $125,000.

articles.author: Kathryn Jean Lopez, Kathryn Jean Lopez
articles.title: The Stillness of Holy Saturday Can Be Our Road to Transformation
articles.description: Welcome to Groundhog Day, Coronavirus Christian style 2020. It’s Holy Saturday, which every year for me is the oddest day of the year. If a church door is open, Jesus seems so far. He is not in the…

articles.author: Kathryn Jean Lopez, Kathryn Jean Lopez
articles.title: The Stillness of Holy Saturday Can Be Our Road to Transformation
articles.description: Have we been Christians going through the motions – at best, on a good day? Will that change now? It has to. But the transformation is a choice.

articles.author: Robert Dean Lurie, Robert Dean Lurie
articles.title: An Exhilarating Tale of European Auto Racing on the Eve of World War II
articles.description: Neal Bascomb’s account of the improbable victory of René Dreyfus over Nazi Germany’s elite racing team has speed, depth, and poetry.

articles.author: Itxu Díaz, Itxu Díaz
articles.title: God Isn’t Dead After All
articles.description: As the coronavirus forces us to eat humble pie, a society that had dismissed God finds its religious conscience stirring.

articles.author: Brian T. Allen, Brian T. Allen
articles.title: The Pulse of the Art World, Mid-Pandemic
articles.description: Virtual auctions, Easter bunnies, a dancing dean, and ceaseless culture war

articles.title: Pandemic and the Consent of the Governed
articles.description: There are worse things that can happen than a pandemic.

articles.title: Gatsby, Mitty, and Hitler
articles.description: 20th-century writers on the disturbing power of fantasy

articles.author: Kyle Smith, Kyle Smith
articles.title: The Stock Market Comeback
articles.description: The markets have partly shrugged off the shock and recovered about half of their losses. But they may be celebrating prematurely.

articles.author: Ramesh Ponnuru, Ramesh Ponnuru
articles.title: Ezra Klein’s Health-Care Advice to Biden
articles.description: Ezra Klein argues that Joe Biden should push for a more ambitious public option than the one already in his platform.

articles.author: Ramesh Ponnuru, Ramesh Ponnuru
articles.title: Trump’s Role in the “Re-Opening” Debate
articles.description: If Trump were to start calling for a re-opening, it would create enormous political pressure, particularly on Republican governors, to accede to his wishes.

articles.author: Ramesh Ponnuru, Ramesh Ponnuru
articles.title: The Cuomo Scenario
articles.description: Democrats have reservations about Biden, but they are not, in general, panicking about him.

articles.author: John McCormack, John McCormack
articles.title: Why Were Only Five Polling Places Open in Milwaukee this Week?
articles.description: Poor planning and coordination among government officials made in-person voting more dangerous that it had to be.

articles.author: Zachary Evans, Zachary Evans
articles.title: Scott Gottlieb: Coronavirus Would Have Been ‘Far More Deadly than Spanish Flu’ if it Appeared in 1918
articles.description: Former FDA commissioner Scott Gottlieb on Friday warned that the coronavirus would have been more deadly than the Spanish Flu if it had appeared in 1918.

articles.author: Rich Lowry, Rich Lowry
articles.title: ‘Blaming China and WHO Isn’t Scapegoating’
articles.description: China and the WHO worked together to expose the rest of the world to the virus at the same time that they downplayed its dangers.

articles.title: Twenty Things that Caught My Eye Today (Good Friday, 2020)

articles.author: Rich Lowry, Rich Lowry
articles.title: No, TV Ratings Aren’t a Good Metric for Presidential Communications in a Crisis
articles.description: Brit Hume, one of the great Twitter follows of our time, had an apt rejoinder to the president.
